intro: Linum usitatissimum var. usitatissimum, commonly known as flax, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Flax is known for its fibrous stalks and oil-rich seeds, which have been used for thousands of years in textile production and as a source of linseed oil. Its botanical features make it a valuable crop in both agriculture and industry.
